result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied.  Fine and costst to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 24 days jail for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.  

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Wolff & Sonderhouse, LLP
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Antonio Martinez in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Edward M Bremberger and Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine $883.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE $100.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendan to pay $50/month commencing 08/01/2016 or alternate of 24 days jail.
Apply any bail that is posted
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing on July 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
trial scheduling order

Defendant Antonio Martinez in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a trial date. Court sets.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Antonio Martinez did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense requests short adjournment.  Court will set this matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 04-04-2016 01:30 pm

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Antonio Martinez did not appear.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense was just provided a pre-trial offer and needs time to go over this with his client. Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
to Appear filed by Attorney Wolff
Hearing at 03-02-2016 10:30 am

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Antonio Martinez did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment and will file authorization by the end of the day. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Attorney Wolff
with cover letter filed by Attorney Wolff
Defendant to pay: $100/month
Hearing at 02-03-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Antonio Martinez in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant had stated that he had went to the public defender's office and did not qualify. Defendant is requesting the court to appoint counsel. Court grants and the defendant is to reimburse the county at the rate of $100.00 a month commencing 02/01/2016 and every month thereafter. Court will appoint Attorney Peter Wolff to represent the defendant.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing at 01-05-2016 09:30 am
Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Antonio Martinez in court.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant to seek counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance at 12-14-2015 08:15 am
